restrictionInstructions.dataDistribution: DISTRIBUTION STATEMENT D: DISTRIBUTION AUTHORIZED TO DOD AND DOD CONTRACTORS ONLY. CRITICAL TECHNOLOGY, JULY 2012. OTHER REQUESTS SHALL BE REFERRED TO NAVSEA 07L. NO SECONDARY DISTRIBUTION AUTHORIZED WITHOUT WRITTEN APPROVAL OF THE APPLICABLE NAVSEA PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OFFICE.

exportRegistrationStmt.simplePara: WARNING: THIS DOCUMENT CONTAINS TECHNICAL DATA WHOSE EXPORT IS RESTRICTED BY THE ARMS EXPORT CONTROL ACT (TITLE 22, U.S.C., SEC. 2751, ET SEQ.) OR THE EXPORT ADMINISTRATION ACT OF 1979, AS AMENDED, TITLE 50, U.S.C. APP. 2401 ET. SEQ. VIOLATIONS OF THESE EXPORT LAWS ARE SUBJECT TO SEVERE CRIMINAL PENALTIES. DISSEMINATE IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROVISIONS OF OPNAVINST 5510.161.

restrictionInstructions.dataDestruction: DESTRUCTION NOTICE: DESTROY BY ANY METHOD THAT WILL PREVENT DISCLOSURE OF CONTENTS OR RECONSTRUCTION OF THE DOCUMENT.

dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

supplyDescr.name: [00653] Hose assembly, air service, No NSN --W/C provide
[01365] Technical manuals/drawings/forms, W/C to provide (NAVSEA S9515-AL-MMA-010, Integrated Low Pressure Electrolyzer)
[01365] Technical manuals/drawings/forms, W/C to provide (Ship Operating Instruction (OI) 635-06)
[01575] Records & logs, No NSN --W/C provide (ILPE LOGS)
[02212] Tools/test equipment, special, No NSN --W/C provide (Special transition fitting - male hose quick disconnect to fitting F6)

footnote.para: Numbers in brackets can be referenced to Standard PMS Materials Identification Guide (SPMIG) for identification.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Forces afloat comply with Navy Safety and Occupational Health (SOH) Program Manual for Forces Afloat, OPNAVINST 5100.19 series; shore activities comply with SOH Program Manual, OPNAVINST 5100.23 series.
Use care when removing cap from fitting F6 as pressure may exist between cap and manual valve. Personal protection equipment, including eye protection, is mandatory.

proceduralStep.para: Obtain permission of cognizant Officer(s) to perform Maintenance Requirement.
Verify GPU is energized and in OFF mode.
Verify BMP is OFF and converter outlet temperature is less than 140°F as indicated on temperature sensor T-1340B.
Vent BMP to ambient in accordance with ship operating instructions.
Remove access panel GPU-11. Shut MV-397-2B.

warning.warningAndCautionPara: Use care when removing cap from fitting F6 as pressure may exist between cap and manual valve.
Personal protection equipment, including eye protection, is mandatory.

proceduralStep.para: Put on faceshield.
Remove cap from blower housing drain fitting F6.
Connect air source to BMP:
Attach transition fitting to BMP fitting F6.
Attach one end of air hose to BMP transition fitting.
Attach other end of air hose to valve ALP-215.
Verify 440 VAC circuit breaker that supplies power to ILPE is closed.
Select BMP from menu; observe BMP Level 2 Screen is displayed.
Open ALP-215.
Open MV-397-1B.

caution.warningAndCautionPara: Admission of air at too rapid a rate will cause excessive temperature differential across catalyst resulting in catalyst degradation. Continually monitor temperature differential across catalyst bed to prevent temperature differential of 25° F.

proceduralStep.para: Slowly open MV-397-2B.
Monitor recycle loop pressure as indicated on pressure indicators P-1334-1B and P-1334-2B.
When recycle loop pressure is between 40 to 60 psig, as indicated on pressure indicators P-1334-1B and P-1334-2B, shut MV-397-2B.
Manually start blower/motor.
Purge recycle loop with air and run blower/motor minimum of 3 hours. Open MV-397-2B as necessary to maintain recycle loop pressure between 40 to 60 psig.
After first 2 hours of operation, raise recycle loop pressure to between 90 and 100 psig.
Record highest temperature achieved, as indicated on temperature sensor T-1340B, while raising recycle loop pressure.
After third hour of blower/motor operation, verify temperature as read on T-1340B, T-1333-1B, T-1333-2B, T-1339-1B, and T-1339-2B is below 100° F.

If any temperature is 100 °F or higher on temperature sensor T-1340B, T-1333-1B, T-1333-2B, T-1339-1B, T-1339-2B, continue running blower/motor until all temperature sensors indicate less than 100° F.
Manually secure blower/motor.
Shut ALP-215.
Vent BMP to ambient in accordance with ship operating instructions.
Remove faceshield.
Remove hose and transition fitting from BMP fitting F6, reinstall cap on fitting F6.
Reinstall cover panel. Secure ILPE in accordance with ship's operating instructions.
Report discrepancies to work center supervisor.
Report completion of Maintenance Requirement to cognizant Officer(s).
